dialog.text: Shadow... why do you feel like a storm inside me?
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: vulnerable, small. Intonation: rising at end, breathy. Speed: slow, hesitant. Tone: childlike curiosity and worry.

dialog.text: Because I've been carrying every 'no' and every scar you tried to tuck away.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: gentle, wise. Intonation: even, reassuring. Speed: measured. Tone: warm, steady like an old friend.

dialog.text: But you scare me. I push you away and pretend you're not there.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: anxious, ashamed. Intonation: quickened, trailing off. Speed: slightly hurried. Tone: small, confessing.

dialog.text: Pushing only tightens the wound. Hiding made you safe from others, but it kept you small from yourself.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: compassionate, firm. Intonation: calming, deliberate. Speed: steady. Tone: gentle teacher, non-blaming.

dialog.text: How do I meet you without drowning in everything you've got?
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: fearful but curious. Intonation: rising-question. Speed: cautious. Tone: young, searching for a map.

dialog.text: Breathe. Witness me like you would a bruise — notice the color, the hurt, without flinching. Ask what it needs, then listen.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: calm, instructive. Intonation: slow, rhythmic. Speed: deliberate. Tone: grounding, very gentle.

dialog.text: I keep feeling shame. I thought hiding would keep me safe from being broken.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: tender, ashamed. Intonation: soft, confessional. Speed: slow. Tone: honest and small.

dialog.text: Shame thrives in secrecy. Light dissolves it. Naming it — out loud, inside you — takes its power away.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: encouraging, poetic. Intonation: warm, metaphorical. Speed: steady. Tone: hopeful and evocative.

dialog.text: If I feel it fully, won't it take over? Won't I become the hurt?
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: worried, doubtful. Intonation: pleading. Speed: moderate. Tone: vulnerable, young.

dialog.text: Feeling isn't being swallowed — it's clearing the room. Stay with the sensation, name it, then choose how you reply. That choice is your freedom.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: firm, empowering. Intonation: rising then steady. Speed: measured. Tone: resolute yet compassionate.

dialog.text: Okay... I forgive myself for hiding. I forgive myself for thinking I needed to be perfect.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: soft relief, sincere. Intonation: calm, affirming. Speed: slow. Tone: healing, quieter strength.

dialog.text: And I forgive you for fearing me. We are parts of one heart — when you welcome me, you reclaim the energy wasted on pretending.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: tender, relieved. Intonation: warm, embracing. Speed: gentle. Tone: comforting, like a hand on the shoulder.

dialog.text: It's like the storm turned into a window. I can see the sky now.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: surprised delight. Intonation: light, rising. Speed: brighter, quicker. Tone: amazed and hopeful.

dialog.text: Remember: the greatest journey is inward. The power you look for outside already lives inside you — waiting for your courage to stop running and start listening.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: inspiring, calm. Intonation: steady crescendo. Speed: measured, deliberate. Tone: deep, resonant, encouraging.

dialog.text: Take a breath. Who is the shadow you can invite in today? Share one small step you'll take to meet them in the comments — or pause and reflect for a moment.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: inviting, gentle. Intonation: soft call to action. Speed: calm, concise. Tone: warm invitation to reflect and engage.
